captions.text:
This week we go in search of
the best motorcycling roads

south of L.A. on the
new Ducati Panigale

I'm at the summit of
Palomar Mountain.

Check that out behind me,
an incredible road.

This is one of the
best motorcycling

Second gear, beautiful curves,
the power of the Panigale--

We came through thick fog and
when we popped out the other

side, we now are above
the clouds.

Oh, am I happy to
see this place.

I ain't seen a fuel station
in ages, and this

Anyway, twisties just down
the road so it's a good

So, we're using the Butler Map
to find the most perfect

So we've taken this blinding
road here.

Another gold run, and
we're right here

This is the Salton Sea you can
see in the background--

We're at 6,000 feet, enjoying
the twists and turns of the

So, we went in search of
California's finest stretch of

motorcycling roads south
of L.A. Oh, it hasn't

We used the Butler
Map as reference.

And we found just about
every stretch of

But I have to tell you, Palomar
Mountain is amazing.

Second and third gear it sweeps
all the way to the top

of the hill, into the cloud,
pop out the other side--
So, what do we have here?

The new Ducati Panigale S.
Absolutely gorgeous Italian

The engine is the fastest, most
powerful twin cylinder

engine on the planet and
it does not disappoint.

It gives the power to weight
ratio nearly the equivalent of

From low down it's got great
tractability, great torque,

and then once it starts pulling
and pulling and those

revs climb high, oh my, hold
on and enjoy the ride.

I'd like to pick some bad points
about this bike, but

absorbing all of the bumps
that you need.

Brembo brakes, touch of a
finger, great stopping power.

You've got three modes,
Wet, Track, and Sport.

You can change those on
the fly to find your

Apart from it costing nearly
$25,000, I can't say anything

I have to be super critical,
and it has one major flaw.
And that is, it ain't mine.
And I am gutted about that.

Oh well, at least I
got a test ride.

title: Finding the Best Roads in SoCal on a Ducati 1199 Panigale - /RideApart

comments.text: This is a great video, and what a gorgeous machine!﻿

comments.text:
I heard this bike has a heat problem getting into the seat.
is that true for all these bikes?﻿
comments.author: ShadowLancer128

comments.text: that is exactly what i needed t hear. thanks dude!
comments.author: ShadowLancer128

comments.text:
All liter bikes can get warm, and I was REALLY concerned about this issue 
coming off of a Ninja ZX6R. I was in the canyons today, with full leathers, 
running it is Sport Mode, between 2-3 gears, and felt absolutely no heat 
problem! When you do feel heat, it mostly comes when the bike is in low 
rpm's, for example, 2nd gear at 4 rpm's while you're behind a slower car 
(the engine becomes inpatient like this). As long as you ride normally, you 
feel warm in jeans (but not bad), but in leathers, not much heat at all! 
Hope this helps: 2014 Panigale S, Black/Stealth Edition!
comments.author: TROY DAVIS

comments.text:
Recently Ducati added some heat shields so i believe its better now.. but 
yes, they had because of the exhaust under the seat.
comments.author: Fábio Andrade

comments.text:
Gotta love Palomar Mountain, both South and East grades are a lot of fun! 
You missed out on some extra great corners though, all in your relevant 
ridden area. You would have really enjoyed Mesa Grande, Banner Grade, and 
the big sweeps down into Borrego Springs.﻿

comments.author: Adam Testa

comments.text:
Nice video, nice ride, and man....awesome twisties. Personally, I don't 
like the one-sided swing arm. I just get a sense of imperfection when I see 
expensive motorcycles with one-sided swing arm. Let it be Honda, BMW, 
Augusta, or Ducati.. I just don't like it.

You didn't need a map to find these places! Should have hit me up! ;) If 
you went from Pally to Sunrise you missed Montezuma and Banner Grade! 
Comparing Palomar to Sunrise of course Palomar comes out on top. Try 
comparing Palomar to Monty or Banner...you'll have trouble picking a 
favorite. Next time you're around these parts I'd love to come ride with 
you fellas!

steel...
